website_summaries.verdict: A one-stop shop if you’re building a new studio or revamping a large acoustic space.
pros: This set contains 96 panels measuring 1-inch x 12-inch x 12-inch, which offers stunning coverage over large areas
Ideal for concert halls, movie theaters, big studios, and auditoriums
Cleaning is simple and entails light vacuuming for dust occasionally
cons: Some users said the tiles were thinner than they expected

customer_reviews.title: Cheap solution
customer_reviews.text: These are cheap foam squares used for removing high frequency issues like slap echo. These are not pro studio grade, nor are they the best quality in and of themselves, but they are a great cheap solution to treating slap echo and strident treble. Be warned, these are not going to soundproof your room. For true soundproofing, you will need restructure your walls with mass-loaded treatments. These will work fine for treble and midrange. Bass will be untouched, but that is expected. It should also be noted that some squares might be thin or slightly off on measurements. Again, these are cheap solutions for sound treatments.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon C.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound absorption.
customer_reviews.text: I put them behind painted canvases and created an awesome sound absorbing room - an excellent scenario because my roommates just had a baby! It doesn't silence outside noise, but it definitely muffles noise from whichever wall you put them on.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Jelinek

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly as a buffer against construction noises in the neighborhood. Easily installed, very fast Prime shipping. Terrific price. If I need more, I'll happily purchase them from this seller. 5 stars and thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Icingdeathe (Tamara McLanahan)

customer_reviews.title: For a few dollars they could switch to a box and ensure they arrive in perfect condition and you wouldn't have to sort through t
customer_reviews.text: I want to give it 5 stars but I can't. When the package arrived I wanted to give it 1. Expected a vacuum sealed bag with at least a few damaged or misshapen tiles. For a few dollars they could switch to a box and ensure they arrive in perfect condition and you wouldn't have to sort through the tiles and throw out a percentage that said, they look great, they improve sound quality within the room they're installed in, reduce noise in/out and are surprisingly resilient.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seriously works
customer_reviews.text: I have a home studio where I mix, master and record. The room had a very noticeable echo and it was obvious when I tried to record. I filled the ceiling with these and it made a world of difference!! '
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Happy kiddo!
customer_reviews.text: Its a little thinner than expected, they are being used in son's room as decoration. BUT, I am also clueless on exactly how thick these things should be anyways. It did not come with instructions on how to apply it to wall. I used an industrial strength double sided tape, epic fail. Nailing it to wall, just would not look right. So I bought very thin crafters boards, cut to each piece, and painted black, glued each piece to the board, then placed a hanger on each board that can not be seen. Looks great! Son is very pleased... looks a little "holloweenish" to me, but orange it his fave color.. so he is happy, so am I.
customer_reviews.author: MoxyM

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for sound absorption
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews I bought 8 packs of these for a small home podcasting studio and put them on 4 walls. We were hoping to cut down the terrible echo in our small room. They did not work..... At all...... Not even a little. We ended up building our own 2'x4' sound absorption panels. We built wooden frames out of 2x2's, filled them with Rockwool insulation and wrapped fabric around them. Works amazing. Don't waste your money on these unless you just want them for aesthetics. Which honestly is the only reason I gave them 2 stars. They look cool in our studio.
customer_reviews.author: LocoValdez

customer_reviews.title: Thin, but work pretty well
customer_reviews.text: I am using these in my classroom for our Podcast "studio" area. I adhered them to the wall with dots of hot glue. They appear to be staying up pretty well. They are not very thick, but they do a fair job of helping to reduce echo when we are recording in the classroom which tends to bounce sound. I mixed them with green ones to match my classroom decor and they look very nice. I got all kinds of "oohs" and "ahhs" from students when they first saw them. All-in-all I think these are a good value and they look nice.
customer_reviews.author: K T

customer_reviews.title: ... them in my new studio and it is the best deal i found
customer_reviews.text: I just got these pads the other day and finish installing them in my new studio and it is the best deal i found. super happy and pleased with the great quality and the quantity you get with the money. It is worth buying this pack and used 3' needle pins to install and it worked perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I'm lining my office wall with these so i can do voice recordings and stream games. It's doing the trick, but they stink to high heaven and having them sit out for a week or 2 does not help. I mean, it probably helps some. Do make sure you take these out of the box immediately and separate them to air out. The smell IS tolerable but I think it gives me a headache some days. I've had them up for almost a month now and the smell is still persistent. Does it ever go away?! XD
customer_reviews.author: SPAM

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for the price
customer_reviews.text: These did wonders for the sound in my room. When recording audio even though my room is filled with objects I would sound like I’m in an empty house. Now my audio recordings sound amazing. I used the box it came in and some other amazon boxes glued them to the foam and used command strips to put these on the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Cedric Sweet

customer_reviews.title: Not noise absorbing as advertised
customer_reviews.text: We had to use a hot glue gun to attach to the wall. Once the entire room was covered, my kiddo went to town on his drums, and much to my absolute horror, there was no difference in the disturbance. So we’ve spent a crap ton of moolah for wall decorations.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: Happy at first but now I'm not
customer_reviews.text: These looked amazing when I first got them but after a few months they have discolored like crazy and are hard to keep stuck against the wall. My blue is now more of a grey green blue mixture no longer the vibrant bright blue. I'll more than likely contact the seller about this.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Trader

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased- great sound dampening!
customer_reviews.text: We used thes for the inside of my daughters' doors since when the two of them together they get loud :) They habe done very well dampening the sound. They are not sound proof so keep that in mind. The bright color was perfect for them and even seems to cheer up the room - they adhered 3D butterflies to make it "pretty" - it has definitely been a parenting 'win'!
customer_reviews.author: amberlee071216

customer_reviews.title: Love These Affordable Gems!
customer_reviews.text: Pad your reflective walls with these, and you will hear a significant difference. I decided to try these out after my expensive, yet effective "Primacoustic London 8" set failed to isolate most of my 10' x10' studio. I needed more, but I was lacking the funds. I found these and decided I had nothing to lose. And once I put up 36 panels, the difference is remarkable. Let's be clear- these are not to SOUND-PROOF your room. The neighbors will still hear you. They will not transform your room into a completely isolated foley stage. What they will do very effectively is reduce reflections. And if you live in LA, they ship REALLY FAST!
customer_reviews.author: Bojack Horseman

customer_reviews.title: It’s just foam, but it still kind of works.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to dampen some of the sound from making it to my toddler’s room. It’s just 12 pieces of foam, not real sound proofing, so I’m not sure it’s worth $25. It does work though. It does not come with any kind of adhesive or way to mount any of them to the wall either. With that said I’ll probably still buy another set because there isn’t anything else that’s this affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good but cheap panels
customer_reviews.text: Good but cheap panels. Definitely not soundproofing but helps with sound reinforcement, deflecting reverb and dampening echo. My only complaint is that I’ve ordered about six packages of these and they come in two different shades of gray on different orders. It’s barely noticeable but on camera you can definitely tell the difference side-by-side. Not a big deal if you’re only doing audio but if you have it as a video background, you want to pay attention to the little things if color consistency bothers you.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: Ok so these are only 1” thick so you can’t expect a miracle. I put them up in my home office with command strips. There has been a noticeable difference so I’m happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Kira

customer_reviews.title: SLOWEST SHIPPING ON PLANET EARTH
customer_reviews.text: IF YOU WANT THESE (the items are fine and work as advertised) IN ANY REASONABLE TIME FRAME SAY (3-4 WEEKS) THEN THIS SELLER IS WHERE YOU WANT TO ORDER FROM! I ORDERED SEVERAL OF THE SAME ITEMS FROM OTHER SELLERS AND HAD THEM IN 3-5 DAYS (KINDA THE NORM) BUT THESE GUYS FELL ASLEEP, WOKE UP TWO WEEKS LATER, AND TOOK ANOTHER NAP BEFORE GETTING AROUND TO SHIPPING THE ITEMS. BE WARNED.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described and works as expected. Will be ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described and works as expected. Will be getting more to cover more wall area now that I've tried them out. I decided to mount this first set on a piece of cardboard and suspend it horizontally from the ceiling above my desk and chair. The assembly is so lightweight I used monofilament fishing line to hang the panel with very small screws into the sheetrock above. It notably reduced the amount of room-echo when I'm on the headset phone.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME! FANTASTIC! WORKED LIKE A CHARM!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect in everyway. They arrived in packaged bundles of 12 and when installed my studio became a great place to do my voiceovers. Love it, will most likely buy more very very soon because I'll be needing like two more of this product to complete the entire studio.
customer_reviews.author: TheBigJay

customer_reviews.title: Decent for its value
customer_reviews.text: These aren't the same kind of foam pads I feel like I've seen used in university, however, they do seem decent enough. Still testing to see how effective they are, but you basically seem to just get your money's worth. Also, don't expect to get these to stick with masking tape, tape does not stick to this foam. I used pins because I don't have a problem stabbing things into my wall since it'll get remodeled eventually anyway, but trying to get sticky material that's strong enough for 12 different panels may not be ideal for everyone, since strips don't always come cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended. I have these on 2x4 foot ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended. I have these on 2x4 foot platters on either side of our stage, both for aesthetics as well as reducing stage noise. Definitely work to cut down the cymbal wash on the stage, though it's worth noting our stage is not that big, about 35 feet across. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Andys

customer_reviews.title: used pillows
customer_reviews.text: Used pillows would be cheaper and more effective than these panels. Actually, anything from the thrift store would be a better value for your money.
customer_reviews.author: Fox0218

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This is being sold as "acoustic foam!??? Don't waste your money, this is flimsy, junky foam used to pad an envelope.
customer_reviews.author: Stones fan

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, basic, poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Basic polyurethane foam. OK for basic echo-dampening in a studio. Cheap, thin. Terrible manufacturing quality control. Two or the 24 panels ordered were not even cut separated, just one block of square, uncut foam. That’s an 8% error rate in a single order. Yikes!
customer_reviews.author: Public Service Announcement

customer_reviews.title: Shipping was a mess
customer_reviews.text: Product works well, the problem I had is they send it in different shipments which made a mess for me since I was charge for several shipments instead of just one. Just for that reason I just give 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Juan C

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: The ones I got were just square boxes, not the hexagons. They also are just basically thick foam pieces and don't stick well to walls, even when I used super sticky carpet tape. Until I figure out what to do with them and how to make them stick on my apartment walls, they just sit there.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Say what?
customer_reviews.text: I’m using these to soundproof thin doors and one part of a wall. First off, foam sticks to nothing. Command strips held it for a few days. Going to spray it glue them into the foam. I tried 4 on a door and it worked well. So once I double that it should block out some roommate noise.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Burson

customer_reviews.title: Dampens sound. Looks great.
customer_reviews.text: We bought these panels to muffle the sound of my son's drum playing in the utility room. We mounted them to wallboard using 3M spray adhesive and spaced them 6" from each other. Not only did this dampen the sound--especially the higher-pitched sounds--but the panels add a nice design to the room that suggests 'recording studio.' My son also has a good amount of pride that he help assemble it with me.
customer_reviews.author: Orange Pops

customer_reviews.title: Hello? I can't even hear me anymore.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a streamer cursed with an all-hardwood office. We're talking wood paneling floors, wood paneling walls, wood paneling ceiling. Needless to say sound dampening is a must in my life. These things aren't just cute, they also killed that wood-office vibe my yeti mic was catching.
customer_reviews.author: Km

customer_reviews.title: Good for general sound absorption
customer_reviews.text: These were great for our recording studio room at Station Houston. The quantity was enough to provide ample coverage in a 10'x15' room, leaving a strip of bare wall along the top and bottom. This only get a 4 instead of a 5 rating because some of them were of different density, so there was inconsistency of quality. Since we used them all in the same room, though, they worked fine as an overall group.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Visually appealing but thats about it.
customer_reviews.text: Giving 4 stars because I purchased these more for aesthetics than I did actual soundproofing. If you need professional soundproofing foam I would skip these. They are not thick or dense enough to provide any real benefits but they look really nice on the walls.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Noel

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good!
customer_reviews.text: We put this up in our sons room to help make the room have less of an echo. I don’t know that it’s has helped a ton with the sound yet but but we only bought one set of 12. They are not all cut to the exact same size so they don’t fit together absolutely perfectly but it looks pretty good. We are happy to have them.
customer_reviews.author: Kmarie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. Except not the color I ordered.
customer_reviews.text: I loved these. They were exactly what I was expecting. Except the color. I ordered purple and I received blue. Which I don’t mind as much as the fact that now when I need to order more do I order purple because they will send blue, or do I order blue and hope they send me the right color.
customer_reviews.author: KendraMae

customer_reviews.title: READ B4 BUYING
customer_reviews.text: This is an honest review These panels will BARELY reduce noise. At most they may absorb some higher frequencys or echos SLIGHTLY. If you are trying to soundproof a room or reduce noise levels or neighbors or roommates this wont be that effective However they do look decently nice placed evenly on the wall so yeah... 2=5
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Work well for my living room to cut down on echoes. Have them positioned above my satellite speakers for my home theatre. I could probably use a few more to achieve my ultimate goal.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great look
customer_reviews.text: I stream video games for people and I wanted a cool and quieter background behind me. These panels were cheap and well cut for what I needed. They are light and easy to hang up on the wall. I’ve received nothing but good compliments on the wall behind me. I recommend sim corner pieces to go with these panels if you will be rapping around a wall.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Great foam, arrived in perfect condition in 3 shipments. The 2" thick 1 sq ft squares are nice because you can cover odd areas or create your own patterns around the room to experiment and get the right sound. Mybecca has very good, fast customer service. The price, quantity and quality was by far the best I could find.
customer_reviews.author: w

customer_reviews.title: Great for noise cancellation and they look great.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the color scheme and design of the panels, they are vibrant and work greatly as intended. The noise cancellation is also very great, the difference was amazing in my opinion and I would recommend these to anybody needing foam panels that look good as much as work as intended! One thing I don't like though is the fact there's no way to properly get them on the wall without having to use adhesives or putting holes in the walls with nails that stick out.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Turns brown
customer_reviews.text: Got the green ones for use in a green screen studio. After a few months, they turn very brown.
customer_reviews.author: Jared K.

customer_reviews.title: Great pice and work very well.
customer_reviews.text: My game room echoed so I thought I would give these a try. They worked great and still work after 4 ish months. I would totally recommend these to any gamers who have simmilar echo issues or are just looking for a cool decoration,
customer_reviews.author: courtney

customer_reviews.title: Great for my recording studio!
customer_reviews.text: This is great for sound absorption. Beats the afgans I was using hands down. :) This product is for absorbing extra sound INSIDE a studio - not for eliminating outside sound. Dang crop dusters. I'll need to get my anti-aircraft equipment before I can do much about them.
customer_reviews.author: Benny Fife

customer_reviews.title: Great sound absorption
customer_reviews.text: I currently have 24 tiles in my drum room. They have helped tremendously with reducing echo and reverb. These won't completely soundproof the room, but it will help muffle the noise a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Fred

customer_reviews.title: Better cheaper options for sound dampers
customer_reviews.text: These provide more of a professional look over functionality. A little over priced, but it does give you something to be proud of. If you want to do something on the cheap. Just make a bunch of big picture frames and wrap them with towels, spray the back of each panel with some foam to kick that up some if you wanted
customer_reviews.author: Dj Tahp

customer_reviews.title: They are a bit brighter orange than anticipated (based on ...
customer_reviews.text: They are a bit brighter orange than anticipated (based on the computer monitor color), and the base of it is much thinner than the similar black ones I got from another vendor. Otherwise they perform as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Looks great
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this in my sons room for his youtube setup. Works great with echo, also looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: If you want a studio buy this
customer_reviews.text: Ordered multiple times and will still order more in the future for sure!!! Bright and last for years!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, I'll buy more.
customer_reviews.text: -1 star because the shades of tiles vary from grey to black. Most of the reviews I've read mention this is a good deal. I'm not an expert in soundproofing rooms, but for watching movies, listening to music, etc. for my apartment this should be good. I bought black poster board and adhesive spray for mounting my foam tiles.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Yates

customer_reviews.title: Update
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry for my last review, I gave only 3 stars because I though i didn't received my complete order. I actually realized the 24 panels were together in one piece. The product is actually really good, just like the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: erasomusic

customer_reviews.title: Green ones faded/yellowed within a month....
customer_reviews.text: These are functional but the purpose of buying green was for chroma key. Non smoking home.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: absorbs sound great... mostly
customer_reviews.text: Is not the best foam I've seen, sounds can escape a bit, not quite as quiet as I would like, but overall does help and I love the purple. Sturdy material, and came fast, helps quite a bit with my work area.
customer_reviews.author: Adrianne

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely reomment it
customer_reviews.text: BANG BANG BABY When you're not allowed to listen to the TV or you media at volumes accustom to you circumstances, The things are like magic.
customer_reviews.author: Consum33r

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: It works for the purpose intended so there is no complaint here.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for price
customer_reviews.text: Definitely thinner than I was expecting, but for the price it is pretty decent. It works well for reducing echo in corners, but have not yet had the opportunity to test it in a full studio environment.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher R Birkinbine

customer_reviews.title: Really thin.
customer_reviews.text: These are really thin. I have an existing set of thick foam tiles. These are about half the thickness. But the product arrived on time.
customer_reviews.author: Franco B.

customer_reviews.title: We used these to sound proof am office where my ...
customer_reviews.text: We used these to sound proof am office where my son does all his gaming. His office is directly under my bedroom and was VERY loud. These panels have made it so the sound is muffled and nearly silent. Thank goodness we found these.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Don't stick to wall!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my nephew for his birthday. They're foam so they're exactly as expected. The problem is they do NOT stick to the walls very well. The are constantly falling down no matter what kind of tape he uses.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it, easy to put up. No damages. My son loves it, he’s using it more for decor! #youtube guy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Low cost solution
customer_reviews.text: Applied correctly this can provide up to two decibels in noise reduction.
customer_reviews.author: Ismael Cortes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Budget Home Studio
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the foam is nothing to write home about, but in the end it gets the job done. I installed these in a spare room in my house and if cut the reverb significantly. You can hear the difference just walking in and out the room and I still have walls and ceiling without foam. I can add more foam in the future for esthetics but it's really not needed for the sound quality I aimed for. Very happy I made the purchase, well worth it for a budget home studio.
customer_reviews.author: briich

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and pretty good. Don't dampen sound as well as some other brands, but they do about half as good a job for a quarter the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson

customer_reviews.title: looks and works great
customer_reviews.text: 100% good, no bad cut and the echo in the studio is gone
customer_reviews.author: Dom

customer_reviews.title: It's ok. Mainly for looks.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for the sound not bouncing around in my room. It looks bigger than it really is and it really ia just foam. If you want your room to damper the sound, invest in a more quality foam/sound damper material. All in all I think it is more for looks not really to help the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Noelani

customer_reviews.title: More decorative than anything.
customer_reviews.text: After rigorous testing. I have come to conclude that using layered bath towels is more efficient than any acoustic foam I have come across. I still like these though like I said mainly they are decorative. You can make some pretty cool chemical formula shapes out of them
customer_reviews.author: Brad Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: They help a little bit with the echo. They rip very easily. Definitely let them air out.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Great bulk buy!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived early and in good condition. These are the best deal for bulk acoustic foam tiles that I could find anywhere. They do need to air out a bit too get rid of the chemical smell. The 2" tiles are great for complete sound deadening, we are using them for a voice over sound booth. They work wonders.
customer_reviews.author: bunz

customer_reviews.title: Greatly reduced the echo/ping
customer_reviews.text: I bought these with the intention of reducing the echo/ping in my high ceiling store. It didn't completely eliminate the echo/ping sounds but it did greatly reduce it. I believe if I had purchased more it would have eliminated it. My store is 1000 square feet if that helps any of you. I also strategically placed them behind thin art canvases.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid investment
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works well and accurately described. My only complaint is it is alil difficult to hang but that night just be my walls.
customer_reviews.author: Bella O.

customer_reviews.title: Good for Intended Purpose
customer_reviews.text: I used these in room where I do audio recording to reduce a small amount of echo from a bare wall, and they've been effective for that purpose. Some of the squares discolored quickly, although they're not in direct sunlight. I might have to replace those, and they haven't been there that long.
customer_reviews.author: john austin

customer_reviews.title: Great price for lots of sound reduction!
customer_reviews.text: These Acoustic Panels were a great purchase! 96 sq. ft. of 2" thick acoustic panels has really made a difference in our family room for a very reasonable price. Arrived in perfect shape and right on time. Look nice, and have definitely lowered the echo coming from our upstairs, largely empty family room.
customer_reviews.author: jm7603

customer_reviews.title: Look cool.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how TRULY effective these are. But they seek to help with some reflective high frequencies and they at least look cool.
customer_reviews.author: Clam Manson

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the proper application
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the proper application. These will do very little in the way of insulating a room of exterior noise. However, they work great at reducing sound reflections within a room.
customer_reviews.author: LoOkOut

customer_reviews.title: It does make a noticeable difference but not as much as I'd expected.
customer_reviews.text: It does make a noticeable difference but not as much as I'd expected it's still better than nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Ddnguy29

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great product!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. I used this to build a mic box for recording an audiobook and it worked really well for this purpose. Lined a cardboard box with this soundproofing foam and it is a great buffer for echo. Makes the recording sound much more intimate as an audiobook should.
customer_reviews.author: S Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: made a big difference in my stream, i was getting a bit of an echo sound in my microphone (blue yeti), so i tossed 24 of these on the wall and it's improved a lot. would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: w0Otah

customer_reviews.title: Good product however it was a little thin
customer_reviews.text: Good product however it was a little thin. I have brought from another company and it was far thicker. But Overall not a bad deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Flick

customer_reviews.title: More than adequate
customer_reviews.text: Seems some of the panels weren't completely straight but it works. Not a big deal and looks great!
customer_reviews.author: Derek Crichton

customer_reviews.title: Great noise absorbency for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great noise absorbency for the price. Product came in as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for great $!
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and does its job; I have a studio to sing in and play piano and the foam does a great job of suppressing the noise.
customer_reviews.author: nbp

customer_reviews.title: perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I took one star off because the panels weren't all cut to the same width. Many were a little over 12" wide, which made it difficult to align things properly. Otherwise, perfect.
customer_reviews.author: SilSpd

customer_reviews.title: It's a great price, but don't expect it to actually treat ...
customer_reviews.text: This foam is more for an esthetic appeal. It's a great price, but don't expect it to actually treat the acoustics in your room.
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: MUST BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy about the price for such a low manufacturing color from all the acoustic foam companies! Very pleased in what my product turned out to be and I will be an all time consumer for this specific manufactur with acoustic foams! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C.

customer_reviews.title: Good product, just needed to be a little thicker in my opinion.
customer_reviews.text: Recieved my panels and the first thing i noticed was the panels were a little flimsier then i expected, but right size and amount for my project. The panels are also cut for you so that saved me time. Using a cardboard backing i used it to sound proof and window and hopefully will do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: Nothing fancy.
customer_reviews.text: I needed some acoustic foam for a project. Six panels for under $10, what's not to love?
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not nearly as dense as I expected and they are not a uniform shade.
customer_reviews.author: mac

customer_reviews.title: Thin and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Not what I was looking for. They're thin and flimsy
customer_reviews.author: Amanda G.

customer_reviews.title: Sound
customer_reviews.text: Very good make my sound a bit more clear and absorb bass
customer_reviews.author: heinczaw

customer_reviews.title: YELLOWS
customer_reviews.text: I loved the stuff when I first got it. So vibrant and green. After a time it got a nasty brown-yellow color.
customer_reviews.author: K. Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Covered the entire area I needed and still have half of the foam left!
customer_reviews.author: thinksojoe

customer_reviews.title: Great for reducing echo in dance studio!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product for the price. Used about 400 ft2 on the ceiling of my 1300 ft2 dance studio to reduce echo. Worked very well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good price Good product
customer_reviews.text: 2 inch panels are a good buy. I use a combination of 2in and 1in panels to smooth or the room. The foam used is not the same quality as some of the more expensive treatments. Difference being density. Which is why only the 2in is recommend. Pictures should show a wall profile view of the 1 in and 2 in.
customer_reviews.author: C. McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Looks good.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift. The panels aren't as deep as I was expecting, but that was just me not paying enough attention to the description. It should work well for the intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Not as thick as I thought
customer_reviews.text: These came in a clear plastic bag, that's it...no box. I have to say that I though they would be a little thicker. I also think it would be good if they had some kind of glue on the back. I just put them up therefore not too sure how much noise they can prevent.
customer_reviews.author: WReid

customer_reviews.title: Not Very Thick
customer_reviews.text: I guess you get what you pay for as these were not very thick acoustic panels
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: Hard to put on wall see review for best way
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price 3M strips will not hold alone. Best way to to spray adhesive paper to the foam then 3M the paper to the wall. Works great
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed worked wonders for recording in small room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: After 2 month, it starts to fade. the color become lighter.
customer_reviews.text: It's thinner than I expected. the 1 inch just count for the spikes not the shallow portion. I put it on my door, but doesn't seems do much. Still can hear sounds if I watch tv inside.
customer_reviews.author: Leo L

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Medium weight and toughness. I cut them with a serrated bread knife. I then glued them to a door skin with wallpaper glue from WalMart...none have fallen off.
customer_reviews.author: apobib

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to mount with included but that's ok, great stuff
customer_reviews.author: Ismael Cortes Miramontes
